SEARCH
Package com.csse3200.game.ui.terminal.autocomplete

Class RadixTrie

java.lang.Object
com.csse3200.game.ui.terminal.autocomplete.RadixTrie
public class RadixTrie extends Object

RadixTrie is a compressed (radix) trie for command-name autocompletion. Each node caches the lexicographically smallest 5 full-word completions in its subtree, enabling suggestTopK(String) to run in O(m) time, where m is the length of the query prefix.

Features

  • Compressed edges (radix) for memory efficiency and fewer pointer traversals.
  • Per-node top-K cache (K = 5) for fast suggestions without DFS.
  • Deterministic, lexicographic ordering of suggestions using String.compareTo(String).
  • Duplicate inserts are ignored; null/empty inputs are safely ignored.

Complexity

  • Insertion: Amortized O(L · log B) where L is word length and B is the bucket size (edges that share the same first character). Buckets stay sorted.
  • Query: O(m) traversal to the prefix locus, then O(1) to return the cached list.

Thread safety

Instances are not thread-safe. If you share a trie across threads, synchronize externally around mutations and queries.

Case behavior

Traversal is case-sensitive. By default, suggestTopK(String) also performs a first-letter case fallback (e.g., the query "he" also considers "He"). Results remain strictly lexicographic by String.compareTo(String). If you prefer purely case-sensitive behavior, remove the wrapper logic and call suggestOneCase(String).

Example


 RadixTrie trie = new RadixTrie();
 trie.insertAll(List.of("help", "heal", "heap", "hello", "helm"));
 List<String> top = trie.suggestTopK("he");
 // => ["heal", "heap", "hello", "helm", "help"]
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • RadixTrie

      public RadixTrie()

  • Method Details

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all entries from this trie.

      The root node object is preserved (to avoid allocation churn), but its state, children, and caches are cleared.

      Since:
      1.0

    • insertAll

      public void insertAll(Collection<String> words)
      Inserts all words from the given collection.
      • Null collections are ignored.
      • Null or empty strings in the collection are ignored.
      • Duplicate words have no effect beyond the first insertion.
      Parameters:
      words - collection of words to insert (may be null)
      Since:
      1.0

    • insert

      public void insert(String word)
      Inserts a single word into the trie.
      • If word is null or empty, the call is a no-op.
      • If word already exists, the call is a no-op.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to insert (full completion string)
      Since:
      1.0

    • suggestTopK

      public List<String> suggestTopK(String prefix)
      Returns up to 5 lexicographically smallest completions for the given prefix.
      • If prefix is null or empty, returns the global top-K from the root.
      • If the prefix does not exist in the trie, returns an empty list.
      • The returned list is unmodifiable and reflects the trie's state at call time.

      O(m) where m is the prefix length: this method walks the compressed path and then returns a precomputed cache. It also performs a first-letter case fallback (see “Case behavior”).

      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix to complete (may be null or empty)
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list containing at most 5 suggestions in lexicographic order
      Since:
      1.0
